author: {'steamid': '76561198044235162', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1606538845}
review:
Senran Kagura has always been a guilty pleasure for me, and I have especially mixed feelings about this installment. I've got a lot to say about it, both good and bad, but let's start with the good.

The gameplay, while deceptively simple, is fun as hell. You've got the D-pad. You've got the four face buttons, and occasionally the L/R button. That's it. No special controller, no complicated techniques, you'll never have to press more than one button on each side of the controller at a time. It's a rhythm game you can just pick up and play, and I like that. Some of the songs are also nice and challenging, and it gets especially hard on... well, the hard difficulty, but it never gets frustratingly difficult.

The music is also very good. I've never paid TOO much attention to the music in previous Senran Kagura titles, but seeing how this one's a rhythm game, the music's kind of important, and fortunately they nailed it. This game features an unexpectedly wide variety of genres, from the obvious ones such as gagaku (being a game about ninjas) and rock (being a rhythm game), to ones you don't commonly hear in rhythm games, such as funk, hip hop, and even salsa. Many songs actually transition from one genre to another as they go. For a game about anime boobies, it is surprisingly innovative.

But, no game is without its flaws, and I have plenty of criticisms to give as well.

The visuals are uncomfortable. For real. It's disturbing even for a Senran Kagura game. if you get good at the songs, you'd better get used to the sight of your opponent cooking while half-naked and crying. That's not even sexy, that's just sad. For god's sake, I just wanna grill!

There's also the issue of difficulty scaling. Like in many rhythm games, some songs are harder than others, and not meant for beginners to the game. But unlike in many rhythm games, all the songs are available right off the bat, with each song being associated with a specific character. The character/song selection screen has zero indication of how hard a given song is, and the story mode has a tendency to throw some of the hardest songs at you early on. If your favorite character's first opponent happens to be, say, Miyabi, or god forbid Rin, well... all I can say is good luck!

My last gripe, both in this review and in my actual experience playing the game, is just how repetitive it gets. Each character's story mode scenario has five songs, the first and last two of which are fixed and accompanied by cutscenes, while the second and third are randomly chosen songs with no cutscenes. This means, to clear all 22 characters' story mode scenarios, you will need to play 110 SONGS. And you'll have to play nearly twice that many if you're going for all the achievements. With only 22 songs to choose from, it quickly becomes a completionist's nightmare... or rather, a completionist's repetitive fever dream. It's unnecessary for story mode scenarios to be five songs long when it's clearly shown that three songs is more than enough to tell a complete story. The repetition isn't helped by the fact that even Arcade Mode has a fixed song order (the order depends on your difficulty selection and the faction your player character is in), making it difficult to mix things up.

But, for all these flaws, they don't take away too much from the main aspects that are most important to a rhythm game: The music and the gameplay. The game is a lot to deal with, but it is also a lot of fun if you're willing to put up with its shortcomings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155938886', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1709446734}
review:
TLDR : Game's good, get it on sale, it's fun, has good songs, plays well but has some graphical and technical issues, no DLC so thanks God for that; it's based on an ecchi anime so indeed, it IS cringy, it IS oversexualized and fanservice is both the reward as well as the main mechanic in the game, so no reason to state the obvious and claim it is "misogynistic" or "perverted", we all know that already, it's overall refreshing, fun and very replayable assuming you like customizing characters, unlocking achievements and high score chasing.

The game features all of your favorite waifus from Senran Kagura (which i didn't even finish back in the day) "cooking" as you press buttons as in any other rhythm game, 3 stages per battle, only the last one really matters as it is the one that decides the winner while the other two serve as a warm up and for you to increase your score but nothing more, it is the THIRD stage the one which decides the winner and by far the hardest to beat, the reward is collecting customization items to use in a dressing room for your character which makes this game very replayable as the main goal is not exactly to beat it but maybe to enjoy the view and the many eye-candies (fanservice) you get for beating every stage as pretty much like in the anime, the girls' clothes get torn away every time they lose (your character as well) and ultimately makes this game an endlessly casual replayable game. Not a rhythm games or Senran Kagura fan, but i was surprised by how refreshing and enjoyable this game was, haven't played much but i can already see where it's going so i'd say it's good, however there are a couple issues i talk about below and i think you should know about it, will update my review if i keep finding issues or manage to fix them.

1.- The game seems to have weird textures all over the place, pixelated images that seem like they were 800 x 600 pasted over 1080p gameplay and animations, i know anime games usually have a strange outline and overall feeling and don't go well along Anti aliasing just the Naruto games, but even after disabling AA on the game i still get ugly textures in both backgrounds and 3D models, it is specially annoying since once you win any round (no spoiler here) the enemy girl gets increasingly undressed and after playing the first duel many times i got to see all of that particular girl's undressing animations which revealed that in different animations the underwear textures load significantly different, haven't found any explanation or solution but girls' undies will sometimes show perfectly rendered and in other cutscenes from a "different angle" they show pixelated and completely messed up, wanna know if anyone has fixed this.

2.- After finally beating the first match against this Haruka girl i went to the dressing room and came back to face the next one, failed my first attempt, went back to the main menu and when headed back to Story mode i was up against Haruka AGAIN, does this mean i have to beat the whole game in one sit?

review: It's a basic rhythm game with the girls from Senran Kagura, not much more to say. Personally, it's one of my favorite rhythm games. If you're a fan of the Senran Kagura series and you fancy rhythm games, I say give it a shot if you're on the fence.

review: Yeah yeah yeah, "super cultured", "easy to play with one hand", "ascii ahegao face". But is the game itself even worth the money? It actually is (I bought it on sale for $5). Though there aren't many songs in this music game, each song sounds professionally composed, is long enough to not get repetitive and you have a good variety of genres like jazz, bubble-gum pop, metal, hard rock, ska, etc. The characters are all likeable, the writing can be actually funny at times, and the core gameplay is challenging enough to warrant continued playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110595954', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 3299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1690176774}
review:
[b]TL;DR summary: A fun rhythm game if you can manage the steep difficulty spikes, with all the over-the-top insanity and jiggling fanservice you'd expect from the franchise.[/b]

Leave it to Senran Kagura to find yet another new way for sexy female shinobi to battle and determine who comes out on top (and still dressed). This time it's a rhythm game to simulate a cooking battle, iron chef style. Two lanes of target buttons scroll right to left, with six (or eight, on Expert difficulty) possible buttons to press, any of which can be on either lane. The beat is set by the music, while a combo of cooking action and cartoon skin in the background tries to distract you from your efforts. Succeed at hammering out the patterns, and judge Hanzo will be so moved by the intense flavour that he'll be whisked away to a bizarre fantasy world, unique to each opponent you defeat (and these scenes are so insane and weird they alone are worth playing for), and then upon return his reaction will be so intense it literally blows the clothing off the loser. You know, because even though it's a rhythm game, it's still Senran Kagura.

The game works well, and it's definitely fun, though it does have a couple points that can be frustrating. Personally, I dislike that all six buttons can appear on either lane (I would have preferred left thumb buttons on one lane only, right thumb buttons on the other only). Another issue is that most of the song is virtually meaningless when it comes to passing the level. Each song has three parts, and the first two only decide exactly how much clothing your opponent is going to lose. Success or failure is wholly decided by the third section, and a late fumble of three or four notes near the end can produce a worse result than a dozen misses in the earlier sections. Of course, perfection in the early part does improve your score, but high scores in Story mode are largely irrelevant, due to the second and third song selection being randomized - the list of songs you get to do impacts your score as much as or more than your skill level.

There are 22 songs, one for each contestant, and though technically each has three difficulty levels to master, most players will only ever play on one. Unlike most rhythm games where the song list gradually gets more difficult as you go through, meaning through the whole library you see a nice spread of challenge, in Bon Appétit all songs basically are the same difficulty, with the one odd exception being Rin, who is a significant leap up from the other 21 characters (as in, her Easy is as challenging as any other Normal). As a result, there's no learning curve, only cliffs, and trying to move up a difficulty notch is a major undertaking. I generally suck at these kind of games, so when I first started I could only do Easy, and to make the jump to Normal difficulty took active effort and practice (which came while working to get the Ninja Art Level 15 achievement, which can only be reached on Normal against either Yomi, Rin, or Daidoji, so I just hammered away at Rin until I finally got a full combo on her level, which trained me well enough to then be able to clear the other much easier songs on Normal as well), rather than passive improvement through incremental challenge increases (such as in Muse Dash). I'm not even going to attempt Expert difficulty, my brief attempts made it clear it will take far more effort and training than I'm willing to invest, or will be able to find fun. As above, it adds two additional buttons to the fray, turning the game into an eight button mashfest.

The songs themselves are mostly elevator music, though tolerably so (I'm a metalhead, and didn't hate any of it), and a few are surprisingly on-point for the matching shinobi - Homura and Miyabi get 80's rock theme tracks, Hibari gets wedding ceremony music, Murakumo's stage has strong sci-fi theme references, and most amusing of all are the stock bullet ricochet sounds that pepper Ryobi's song. In this way, it seems there was more effort in making the music fit the character than actually explaining who the characters are, how they know each other, or what the confusing good or evil labels attached to them mean. The game has no background exposition, so unless you're already familiar with the Senran Kagura franchise and characters, you may end up with a lot questions unanswered - things like why Murakumo wears a mask, where Ryobi's breasts go when you defeat her, why Yozakura is such a bitch, or why Ryona...well...is Ryona, will remain a mystery to you even after finishing their story sets. Those stories also vary wildly in scope, ranging from perfectly logical (Homura, Murasaki), to weird but amusing (Asuka, Hikage), to batshit insane (Katsuragi, Ryona). But of course, that's assuming you even care about a story - this is a rhythm game with bouncing cartoon boobs, and if that's all you want, the "Free" and "Arcade" modes are stripped down (pun intended) to that exact level. The game delivers precisely what it promises, at a fair price, and (unusual for Senran Kagura) without a dizzying array of overpriced DLC needed to get all the content. 

And it's fun. 

And it's sexy. 

And I definitely recommend.

.

.

.

.

Also, Yomi best waifu. Had to be said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095172022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1588469079}
review:
The game was exactly what I was expecting, but without any real sense of investment or fun. I'm quite the fan of rhythm games such as DDR, Beat Saber and Muse Dash, so I figured a Parappa-style game with sexy anime ladies in a Food Wars setting would be up my alley. 

Unfortunately, the game felt hollow. There's very little actual content here, even for a SK game. The story mode is a joke, as it's just the arcade mode with more dialogue and a spicy picture at the end. I understand it might be foolish expecting a real storyline in a spinoff game, as even the game's narrator points out, but without any sort of narrative, the game depends entirely on the gameplay and fan service to keep you engaged. Most rhythm games are like that (minus the fan service), so as long as the gameplay is good, this isn't a problem.

Unfortunately, the gameplay isn't good. It's six buttons. Sometimes you can hit two at the same time. A ninja art works like the star power in Guitar Hero. There is some challenge to be had, but the simple mechanic and forgettable music gives you no sense of accomplishment. There's also a crazy spike in difficulty between Easy and Normal.

So if the gameplay is no good, the music is bland, and there's no story, surely the fan service is great, right?

Not really, no. I'll bet nearly 100% of players have already played at least one of the mainline SK games (Shinovi Versus, Estival Versus, etc.). If you like cheesecake, just stick to those games. Not only do those games have better dressing rooms, but the gameplay itself complements the ability to destroy clothing as you can see your opponent become more exposed as they take damage. Here, the characters and gameplay reminded me of DDR in that you only pay attention to the moving arrow keys you need to hit while completely ignoring the distracting, moving background. You cant even enjoy the cheesecake the game offers because you're trying to play the game, and you cant do both at the same time. 

Minor note, the underwear textures looked super low res. That's understandable since this game is a port from the PS Vita, a handhold console, but that just reinforces why playing Shinovi/Estival Versus is a better use of your time.

Although I didn't hate the game, I overall found it a very boring an unfulfilling experience. I got the game on discount for $5.00. I think that's a fair asking price for the game before discount sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286640422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2636, 'last_played': 1694678470}
review:
Juego para pervertidos, así de simple.
Algunas cosas a decir:
Lo bueno:
-Juego ritmico, bastante divertido, tu tecleas, ellas cocinan
-Buena jugabilidad
-Waifus buenisimas, que tan bueno seas es determinante...mejor rendimiento = menos ropa = recompensas rikolinas ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
-La música es bastante agradable, algunas pistas son muy buenas
-Dress room, observalas, vistelas, tocalas...tu ya sabes.
-Oppais a 60fps
-3 modos de dificultad, donde el dificíl realmente es difícil
Lo malo:
-Los gráficos son del PSvita, o sea un un poco pixelados
-No tiene mucho contenido, son 22 canciones, 3 modos donde tecnicamente son lo mismo
- No tiene PVP :'( (hubiera sido genial)
- No se puede jugar con 1 sola mano (╯ ͠° ͟ʖ ͡°)╯
Algunas cosas más:
-No aporta nada a la historia principal de SK, cada chica tiene una historia, algunas son muy divertidas, otras son regulares y algunas son meh.
-El combate se divide en 3 fases, donde la única que importa es la 3ra.
-Respecto al modo historia o el arcade, no hay dificultad progresiva, o sea te puede tocar una canción complicada de inicio o una fácil de final.
Juego para pervertidos (como io), 9/10, muy recomendado si lo pillas en oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003913540', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2001, 'last_played': 1584961091}
review:
I had TONS of fun.
I never really played the rhythm game so this was my first but hell I am not dissapointed. 
I love that the senran kagura tries a different approach. 
Fanservice - check (and boy oh boy it is fun).
Funny/cute character interactions - check
Most important I guess - music! Music is a masterpiece. 
Although there were not many songs with vocals the ones without were very catchy.
Game never crashed and was always running smoothly.
As for achievements - ok. No online crap etc, fairy easy (you don't have to play on hard thank god as that would destroy me :D)

9/10 Would Eat Special again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008962715', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1580270511}
review:
[h1]An experimental game that hasn't aged well.[/h1]

Senran Kagura. I really enjoy this franchise, there are a lot of gems in it. There is also a lot of trash. I'd been eyeing this game with a mixture of curiosity and trepidation for a long time. Turns out my hunch was right all along. Fair warning, I'm pretty serious about rhythm games so I'm reviewing it as such.

This was by and large the first experimental Senran Kagura game. Kenichiro Takaki, the director, was interested in spinoffs with the thematic overlay of Senran Kagura, marketing them with the Senran Kagura cast in mind. The game is very much an artifact of its time. This was made for handheld consoles and as such the gameplay loop is very short. Unlike other senran kagura games, there is next to no exposition or story. All interior story archs are just short joke segments as typical of the sidestories of the mainline games.

As per the staple of these games, there is ample butt and boob time, plenty of sexy (and hilarious) outfits to choose from, and delicious meals with waifus cooking them. I felt very little reason to dress up the characters this time though; unlike every other Senran Kagura game, there is very little reason to pay attention to the girls in the core gameplay loops. In fact, doing so will lose you the game. The game handles its humor very well, and is ridiculously over the top. A fun game to watch for sure. However, the graphics have not aged the softcore or the food porn well for a 3D anime game. While the animations are attractive, more than often not you'll notice the low poly models, bad shading & outlines, and repeated textures. A little too uncanny valley in this day and age. While menus scale well, many 2D graphics including the much important character sprites look very bad upscaled to 1080p and higher resolutions. 

As for the rhythm game itself... its bad. It has the typical notes matched to buttons coming down lanes displayed horizontally on the screen. Similar to familiar arcade cabinet rhythm games. On the surface the game is most similar to the Miku and Taiko rhythm games. However, the kicker is there are 4 to 8 buttons (depending on difficulty), but only two lanes for those notes. Furthermore, notes can appear on [i]either lane[/i]. On top of this, its meant to be played on a controller where the button layout is in a cross or diamond, with no intuitive translation from hands to screen besides the colors and shapes of the buttons. Only a third of the entire screen-space is even utilized for the rhythm game elements either; the rest is showing the cutscene of the buxom cooking girls. The best part of the gameplay itself is you are rewarded for doing very well with a bonus cutscene at the end of every level, however to get to that point you have to watch extremely distracting fanservice being shoved in your face as you try and concentrate on the rhythm game. As far as rhythm games go, it plays very unintuitively and is frustrating. There are no quality of life features to adjust the way the game plays either, such as speed settings or offset.

The music itself is only just okay. They take no old classics from previous senran kagura games for you to play here, instead its filled with original compositions. In some cases this is good, in many others its bad, as half the appeal of a rhythm game is the emotional attachment the player has to the music. Instead of the music, the intention is for the emotional attachement to be to the waifus themselves. This would work, if more screentime (that you're actually able to watch & has characterization) were devoted to them at all. If you're not familiar with Senran Kagura, there is no sense to be made here.

Ultimately, the game's charm lies only in its initial gimmick; the realization that it is a cooking contest with senran kagura characters, humor, and sexiness. Its fun to watch, and its miserable to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312538816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3358, 'last_played': 1685678675}
review:
Senran Kagura Bon Apettit es un spin off, por lo tanto no tiene ninguna relevancia en el canon principal de la serie.
Su modalidad de juego es del tipo ritmico, es decir, la canción que saldrá será diferente para cada una de nuestras chicas, lo que pondrá a prueba nuestra habilidad, ya sea con el teclado o con algun mando de consola para acertar en cada canción.
Debo decir que, independientemente de todo el fanservice que hay en este juego (porque todos sabemos que esa es la atracción principal de la serie), en lo personal me pareció bastante entretenido. Al principio parece el tipico juego ecchi japones (y ciertamente si que lo es), pero la verdad me sorprendió lo divertido y adictivo que se puede volver. Cada una de las chicas tiene su propio tema que les queda perfecto y en las dificultades mas altas las melodías se vuelven todo un reto.
Poco importa la historia, lo que importa son las canciones (y lo que les sucede a las chicas si obtienes puntajes altos, claro que si)
Para finalizar, no creo que sea para todos los publicos ni tampoco para los amantes de los mejores videojuegos, pero si te quieres entretener un par de horas con las chicas de Senran Kagura esta es una muy buena opción.

review:
[h1] TL;DR [/h1]
The game has a big variety of soundtracks that slap and there's one for everybody. Like other Senran Kagura games there are tonnes of customization options. The story is comedic with definite fan service, you will for sure get the hours you are looking for in this game. "But Magicalgirl, you only have 25 Hours" I only played it or the achievements I swear.

[h1] "haha wow so funny" one liner [/h1]
This isn't the cook serve delicious I was looking for. This is the cook serve delicious I needed.

[h1] Gameplay[/h1]
[b] Gameplay [/b] - SENRAN KAGURA Bon Appétit! Does have repetitive gameplay, also fast gameplay but come on, What did you expect from a rhythm game? You still have your Shinboi arts.
[b] Controls [/b] - Depending on what you use, Keyboard or controller, the controls are going to be all over the place in terms of track notes, you have WSAD and UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT for keyboard and UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT and Y,A,B,X For controller.
[b] Multiplayer [/b] - I haven't tried multiplayer, I like playing some of the games against AI or solo because it's chill, so you'll have to decide if the game is dead or not.

[h1] Soundtrack [/h1]
There's a LOT of soundtracks in this game, 22 To be exact. You have different varieties from hard rock, hip hop, a combo of the two and classics.

[h1] Graphics/Art [/h1]
Graphics were great 69/10 But in all seriousness they made the game great without the cell shading being too much. Aside from some hair or clothes clipping into each other, it's great, just like their other games... Which you should play.

[h1] Story [/h1]
The story you're going to be diving in faces culinary perfection, it's like that hell kitchen show but minus the Gordon Ramsey and shouting. Sushi chef Hanzo holds a competition to see which of the girls can master her ninja arts best for cooking as opposed to combat. You still have the bust of your favourite girl, and the loser is a dessert (This isn't a joke they're covered in a dessert, cute, tasty and embarrassed)

[h1] "Should I buy this game?" [/h1]
[list]
    [*]Do you like Anime? - Yes.
    [*]Do you like anime lewds? - Yes.
    [*]Are you an achievement hunter? - Yes.
    [*]Do you like rhythm games? - Yes.
[/list]

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Thank you for reading, and I hope you enjoy the gameplay, girls and music! I know for a fact if you love the Senran series you will love this one. There IS replayability, there are TONNES of achievements, good music, what's not to like?

review: The game starts off fun and is a blast for anyone who enjoys rhythm games & overly sexual games. However, when you play on Normal difficulty, there is a glaring issue that sucks most of the fun out of the experience out of the game for me. Regardless of how well you do on 2/3 of the song/battle, if you screw up a little bit in the last third, you will lose no matter what. Definitely is one thing that is hard to overlook for me as it makes it feel like you might as well have done nothing for most of the song.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201523314', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1581624876}
review:
Con una jugabilidad simple, este juego es excelente para aquel que quiera arrancar con los juegos rítmicos. Cuenta con una personalización enorme para cada personaje, así que podés vestir a tu waifu como gustes ~
Tiene bastante fanservice por lo que puede molestar a más de alguno, pero sinceramente hablando, estos juegos son conocidos justamente por eso y recompensa al jugador con muchas escenas...interesantes. Vas a estar sacando capturas todo el tiempo.

PD: Si llega a haber algún problema con el mando de PS4, simplemente sacar en Big Picture la opción "Configuración de mando de Playstation". Por alguna razón que desconozco no reconoce el joystick y tuve que dar muchas vueltas hasta que leí que la solución es tan simple como destildar una opción. Espero esto ayude y encuentren útil la reseña y el tip :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198303149744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1622759763}
review:
Video reseña:
https://youtu.be/ZuyFZ6Zwbrk

La mecánica del juego es bastante sencilla, consiste en un juego de ritmo en el que deberás precionar el botón indicado en el momento preciso, y así ir cargando una barra qué equivale a la calidad del plato. 
Esta disminuirá si te equivocas; si aciertas en el momento justo se llenará.
En la partida despues de determinado número de combos aparecerá una nota con forma de corazón, al acertarla la camara se enfocará en tu oponente con muy buenos ángulos que fácilmente pueden distraerte. 

Cada partida tiene tres fases, en las que Hanzou irá probando lo que las chicas han preparado y dará la victoria de la fase a la que tenga el plato con mayor calidad. 
En cada fase la ropa de la chica que pierde será dañada. 
Sí ganas las tres fases podrás ver una escena en la que la chíca que ha sido derrotada estará en una secuencia especial sobre un plato. En esta escena podrás jugar con la cámara para verla desde diferentes ángulos.

El juego cuenta con distintos modos. El modo historia que sería la campaña por cada una de las chicas. 
El modo Arcade en el cual enfrentarás a una chica tras otra hasta llegar al final. 
El modo Free play, en el que podras elegír con que chica jugarás y contra cual se enfrentará. 
El Modo de vestier, donde podrás cambiar la ropa de las chicas según la vayas desbloqueando al completar diferentes partidas. 

En cuanto a la dificultad esta muy bien calibrada para todo tipo de jugador. En la dificultad fácil así seas negado para este tipo de juegos se puede disfrutar bastante, y en dificultades mas altas sera un buen desafío.

Conclución
Hay que tener en cuenta que la calidad del juego al ser un port algo antiguo de PS Vita esta demasiado limitado en cuanto a los gráficos y menús.
otro punto no muy bueno es que juego cuenta con muy pocas canciones con létra, únicamente tienen letras las de las cuatro líderes de escuelas y las dos personajes extra Rín y Daidouji, El resto son únicamente melodías originales sin letra para cada una de las demas chícas. Esto es algo desepcionante teníendo en cuenta qué uno de los fuertes que tiene Senran Kagura es el excelente casting de actrices de doblaje.
Aun así este es un buen juego casual que se puede disfrutar para partidas cortas, ademas usualmente durante las rebajas se encuentra a muy buen precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022079241', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 447, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1658520665}
review:
"Bon appétit" ? 
Il en faut, car il y a du contenu.

Senran Kagura est une licence d'action sexy truffée de demoiselles hautes en couleurs, qui n'ont pas froid aux yeux et se frottent à tout danger. Jusque là, tout roule !

C'est ici qu'intervient le rouleau à pâtisserie, justement : dans "Bon appétit", les minettes cuisinent, sur le fil d'un jeu de rythme. En pratique, vous choisissez une poulette, la mettez aux fourneaux, et assurez le cooking lors d'une périlleuse enfilade de touches à appuyer en rythme.

Le roaster est vaste, la garde robe se déverrouille petit à petit, et les modes de jeu (story, arcade, free, principalement), se présentent confortablement, à la carte, sous 3 niveaux de difficulté.

Non seulement le tempo et les QTE (car un jeu de rythme n'est finalement qu'un vaste QTE !) peuvent vous donner du mal, mais il faut rester très concentré(e), sans trop regarder ce qui se passe en cuisine : et c'est un peu chaud, en cuisine, justement.

Focus ! il s'agit d'activer la bonne touche au bon moment, et le pad est ton ami.

Le jeu est réellement agréable, convivial et visiblement réalisé avec soin, notamment tout ce qui touche à la personnalisation / customisation de nos donzelles, ainsi que le menu complet proposé : différents modes, dressing room, collections diverses...

J'apprécie fortement son approche traditionnelle aussi : les femmes se concentrent sur deux uniques compétences, le charme et la cuisine.
C'est plaisant de retrouver cet idéal et de s'y complaire le temps d'une session.

Mais tout ceci serait oubliable sans l'humour forcené de ce jeu, qui met en scène une sorte de Maître Goûteur, à côté de qui "Un dîner presque parfait" fait figure de sitcom ampoulée.
Lui va vous dire très clairement ce qu'il pense de votre plat, dans une surenchère d'effets manga, et, selon la note, une juste récompense sous forme de pin-up culinaire. Je vous laisse la découvrir.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1890503545

Bien sûr, ça reste un jeu occasionnel, qu'on va ressortir avec un whisky-coca-cherry ou ce genre de soirée, mais il se montre très dynamique, accueillant et, pour les afficionados du rythme-game, peut vous donner des sueurs : ça déménage sévèrement, et le tempo accélère parfois réellement, tandis que vous devez suivre 2 lignes de touches en parallèle, mais pas tout à fait en même (contre) temps...!

Je le recommande en pack (à faire soi-même :^u) avec "SENRAN KAGURA Estival Versus", le crossover alléchant vous permet alors de switcher entre les combats de plage et la cuisine, avec les mêmes personnages.

Enfin, je dirais que chacun(e) juge s'il est honteux ou pas de détenir ce genre de titres dans sa bibliothèque; pour ma part, j'ai tranché depuis longtemps et me reconnais sans problème comme un amateur de bons jeux chaleureux, quand ils sont subtilement réalisés (les Hunie, par exemple).

Il existe bien un patch pour ce "Bon appétit", qui ajoute un peu de poivre, mais rien d'indispensable : les Senran Kagura sont  légers, drôles et mignons, n'y cherchez pas du hard-hentaï ou trop de fan service. Ici ça joue, ça crame la manette même,  et on mérite sa petite galerie sexy.

[edit 2023] très agréable entre ami(e)s aussi, le jeu a mis l'ambiance en pleine session gaming plus "sérieuse". 

[ bonus ] Pour l'anecdote, je jouais à ça quand mon rdv Tinder est arrivé. Il s'est désinhibé direct et j'ai fini la nuit bien k.o XD

review:
Thank God for in-game keyboard prompts.
This game is great. It's a cooking rhythm-style game. The songs are amazing. The game can be a bit too difficult at times, but it's fun. Hanzō also got a lot of lines and screen time here, which is great. The voice acting is also FANTASTIC.

The only bad thing is that when you get the heart thing, the girls start dancing (???) and the camera pans around them. The textures are WAY TOO LOW for this stuff. It looks gross. Yes, you will be looking at the two bottom bars for almost all the times, but it's kinda gross.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347572472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1606924282}
review:
[quote][h1]音游与福利的结合[/h1][/quote]

[h1]引言[/h1]

《闪乱神乐：忍乳负重》最初是2014年发售于PSV平台上的一款休闲音乐游戏，于16年双十一移植PC端并发售。本作依旧拥有闪乱系列出色的福利制作水平，玩法操作也十分容易上手，不过无论是对音游玩家，还是单纯追求者该系列福利而来的玩家，游玩过程中多少还是有一些影响游戏体验的方面，考虑到早年移植的缘故也就无可厚非了，游戏质量还是值得入手游玩。

[h1]想看美少女，请选简单难度[/h1]

游戏提供了故事、通关与自由对战三种模式，由于内容上差异性不高，本作全成就更多只需要花时间去肝即可。三种模式下玩家可在22名美少女中任意选择进行游玩，操作上类似于太鼓达人从右往左不断输送的按键符，通过准确按下对应的按键来获得高额的分数奖励，能够烹饪出更美味的美食，赢得评委的赞赏。

每一位人物都需要连续完成六段曲目才能够完成该人物的剧情线路，每一段曲目分为三个不同菜式的烹饪阶段，是否赢得胜利的判定取决于在第三阶段中获得的分数。前两个阶段的胜利能够蓄满爱心，在第三阶段中能够从不同视角下观看对战角色的全貌，如果三个阶段都取得优势的话则为完全胜利，对战结束之后会送上一段美少女被美食覆盖的福利动画。

对战过程中，游戏是以美少女烹饪时的各种动态操作为背景放送，不过即便在普通难度下进行游玩，在进行某些曲目的挑战过程中，是没有多余的目光投放在养眼的美少女身上，更多的注意力都放在了输送而来的按键符上。再加上本作两行轨道的设定，如果一不小心分神，很容易就按错，一旦到了第三阶段，美少女们烹饪时的切菜动作会加倍速放送，可能对于技术高超的音游玩家而言，他们的目光能够包[揽整个游戏界面，福利与高分兼得，但对于普通的音游玩家与路人玩家更多的是眼花，只能兼顾一方，卡关的话也是避无可避了。

所以，如果是想要在对战过程中观看养眼的美少女，又想体验一下音游，建议每一个角色都选取简单难度进行游戏。普通难度需要练习一到两遍才可以完成一些角色的最终挑战曲目，比如大学姐，至于困难难度，普通玩家可能按都按不过来了，高玩可以选择困难难度进行挑战。

[h1]多种服饰满足换装玩家[/h1]

本作最让人满意的方面，还是游戏内提供了大量的服装与饰品进行装扮了。不同于闪乱系列之后的作品，各种各样且常年不打折的服装DLC也许会让一部分预算不足的玩家劝退，在本作中则没有这种顾虑。初进游戏时已经提供了数目可观的服装，通过完成每一位人物的对战还能够解锁更多的服饰，更衣室玩家可以随心所欲地为美少女们换上各种各样地服装进行观赏。不过有一点不好的是，新获取的服饰没有特定的NEW标识，玩家在寻找过程中会浪费一些时间，交互方面地体验多少有点不愉快。

[h1]不足：移植画质与操作性[/h1]

作为移植作品，人物建模的质量尚可，不过游戏整体的画质就不尽人意了。尽管游戏提供了2048*1152的分辨率，设置之后游戏内大部分的静态场景十分模糊，爆衣场景中部分服饰贴图非常模糊，基本与精致二字不沾边，很难满足那些想要截图上传或者用作壁纸的玩家。

至于操作方面，如果使用手柄的玩家需要注意的是，游戏不支持原生的xbox手柄，如果没有在steam上进行强制关闭手柄的设置，进入游戏之后只能够通过键盘来进行游戏。虽然影响不大，动动手百度一下就能解决的问题，不过作为消费者而言，更多是想要愉快流畅地体验游戏，而不是给各种小毛病给困扰╮(╯▽╰)╭

[h1]结语[/h1]

每一个人物剧情完成时间，基于简单难度下，需要二十分钟左右，普通难度看操作水平。如果想要解锁更多服饰，进行更衣室玩法的玩家，那么直接选择剧情游玩即可~比起之后的作品，本作的肝度不算太高，如果喜欢休闲音乐游戏，又想观赏福利的玩家，本作在各种促销活动中26元的史低价格十分值得入手游玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198138879464', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1629171389}
review: As someone who has the first 6 Project Diva games, when I heard Senran Kagura had a rhythm game, I was super excited. Since it's a spin-off, the plot isn't necessarily important; I believe it's all non-canon to the main storyline of the franchise. You have both Hanzo and Homura's Crimson Squad with "DLC" of Gessen and Hebijo, including Daidoji and Rin. The actual rhythm game itself is much more forgiving than Project Diva as far as timing and accuracy go. Most if not all the gameplay is just the rhythm game and the standard Senran Kagura Dressing Room. The achievements are a little buggy, such as not unlocking until you save and quit the game completely, instead of popping up in the corner while playing. For the achievement collector standpoint, all the achievements for this game were fairly easy to acquire; not requiring advanced skill but simply more time put in. I'd consider 1 achievement to be a slight challenge; to essentially get a very long combo. Towards the end, a couple of the last ones are a bit grindy but not difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051827900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1603731626}
review: This game is actually quite fun. Obviously it's styled like a DDR kind of game or even a couple of the Pokemon Stadium mini games, but it's actually kinda hard at some points. The lovably lewd characters return in another weird spin-off that has it's funny moments. There's not much to the game, besides the customization and groping. Honestly, I'd prefer this being on the Nintendo Switch more than Peach Ball, or even being a playable option in one of the other games itself.  All in all, it's a fun play, and sometimes it's hard to focus on getting your notes right, with all the butts and boobs going everywhere, I never thought losing a cooking game could be so great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087517685', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1590161165}
review:
I enjoy rhythm games very much and this is also one of them.

Game mechanics
- Two lines
- 8 buttons
- Has single notes and holds, and also streams

But lemme tell you, this game is HARD af. Here's why
Challenges
- Had the same problem when playing Hatsune Miku games the first time - it's confusing to register the notes to your muscle memory
- Background animation can be a distraction
- The HP drain rate can be very very unforgiving. Missing 3-4 notes consecutively can lose you the whole match
- Stripping of anime tiddies can be a distraction
- Even when you change the key layout, the shape of the note changes to that key letter so it's still confusing
- Zooming into anime buttocks when successfully hitting a LOVE note can be a distraction
- I wish I could customize what shapes the notes are so I can read the notes better, but I guess it's a challenge
- Naked anime tiddies cooking in the background can be a distraction

But the songs are surprisingly fun, because I was wondering what kind of songs would Senran Kagura offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136854603', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1682798515}
review:
You all know why we're here, and it's ****ing disgusting! Anyways, this game is rather simple. It's a rhythm game in the same vein as the Persona: Dancing All Night games. The premise is rather simple: the girls from SK have decided to take a break from their ninja careers to participate in a cooking competition with Hanzo acting as judge. Your objective is to simply push the correct buttons at the correct time. The better you perform, the better they perform (no pun intended.) The unlucky soul who gets the short end of the stick gets some article of clothing ripped off; I assume, by Hanzo (the creep). The loser of the competition will be left in nothing but their underwear (which is, in some cases, just a band-aid covering their nipples...yeah). 

Pros:
Easy enough to pick up and play. 
The songs are really catchy. 
Different modes to easily jump into

Cons:
The fanservice. It's very, VERY gratuitous. If it was just underwear, I might not mind so much, but the fact is some girls are pretty much topless with some of their outfits, so that's kind of an oof... 

Now, why am I making a positive review if I don't like the fanservice. Well, there are at least a couple of reasons. 1). My manhood doesn't care and (2 I find the positives to be worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079503052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1594854225}
review: Petits gourmands adepte de musique endiabliée japonaise, ce jeu est fait pour VOUS! Oui monsieur! Ou même madame! N'ayez pas honte de franchir le cap et de vous lancer dans un jeu de rythme où tout vos sens connaîtront le bonheur en même temps! En effet, la musique est entraînante, les bons petits plats ainsi que leurs accompagnements vont vous ravir les papilles, vous faire miroiter devant ces formes et couleurs! Même sans les véritable odeurs, Gaspard Savoureux vous fera bien comprendre à quel point vos mets sentent bons! Il ne reste donc que le toucher mais... Cela ne dépend que de VOUS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198265420342', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1559413572}
review:
[b][h1]Знакомство с серией[/h1]
Помню,как воспринимал "аниме-игры", как новеллы на подобии сериии игр "Сакура" или же другие "Эро-новеллы", но это подобие интерактивного(не сказал бы,что интересного, но в данной части музыкального) геймплея и совмещения с эро-частью,как и с сюжетом открыло мне новые взгляды.
[quote=Tamiko][url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1758200357[/url][/quote]

[h1]Забавные факты > Спойлеры[/h1]
[spoiler]Если выполнить все три этапа поединка идеально(то есть, накопив фулл сердечко) открывается сцена с дедом-извращенцом и после мини кат-сцена с обнажённой героиней[/spoiler]
[quote=Tamiko][url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1757178440[/url][/quote]

[h1]За что стоит любить игру и за что нет[/h1]
+
[list]
[*]Интересные Осты
[*]Довольно большое количество выбора персонажей
[*]Расширенный кастомайз
[*]Тематика совмещения ритмов во время кулинарных поединков
[*]Безусловно эро-часть
[*]"Химия" между главными героями
[/list]
-
[list]
[*]Смазанные текстуры,особенно при приближении
[*]Кастомайз одежды мог быть и больше
[*]Хорошие осты, но однообразие - в той же сюжетке
[*][spoiler]В сюжетной линии есть конкретно один противник,который гораздо сложнее[/spoiler]
[*][spoiler]Однообразие кат-сцен с дедом-извращенцом[/spoiler]
[/list]
[quote=Tamiko][url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1758198813[/url][/quote]

[h1]Оценки[/h1]
Атмосфера: 7/10
Музыкальное сопровождение: 8/10 
Графика: 6/10
Сюжет: 6/10
Оптимизация: 10/10
Оценка как часть серии: 7/10

[u]Общая оценка: 7.3[/u]

[i]Спасибо, что оценили мой обзор, ваш покорный слуга Тамико :3[/i][/b]



[b][h1]Introduction to the series[/h1]
I remember how I perceived "anime games" as novels in the likeness of the Sakura series of games or other Ero novels, but this is similar to interactive (I would not say interesting, but in this part of the music) gameplay and combination with the erotic part, as with the plot, has opened up new views for me.
[quote=Tamiko][url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1758200357[/url][/quote]

[h1]Fun Facts > Spoilers[/h1]
[spoiler]If you perform all three stages of the match perfectly (that is, after accumulating a full heart), a scene opens with a pervert grandaddy and after a mini cut-scene with a nude heroine[/spoiler]
[quote=Tamiko][url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1757178440[/url][/quote]

[h1]For what it is worth loving the game and for what it is not[/h1]
+
[list]
[*]Interesting Osty
[*]Quite a large number of character choices
[*]Advanced customization
[*]Theme combining rhythms during culinary fights
[*]Certainly ero-part
[*]"Chemistry" between the protagonists
[/list]
-
[list]
[*]Oiled textures, especially when approaching
[*]Customize clothes could be more
[*]The good ones are cool, but the monotony is in the same plot.
[*][spoiler]In the storyline, there is specifically one opponent who is much more difficult[/spoiler]
[*][spoiler]Monotony cut-scenes with a pervert grandaddy[/spoiler]
[/list]
[quote=Tamiko][url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1758198813[/url][/quote]

[h1]Ratings[/h1]
Atmosphere: 7/10
Musical accompaniment: 8/10
Graphics: 6/10
Storyline: 6/10
Optimization: 10/10
Rating as part of a series: 7/10

[u]Overall rating: 7.3[/u]

[i]Thank you for appreciating my review, your humble servant Tamiko :3[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198159297213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1562340153}
review:
スーパーファミコンの呪いに打ち勝つのに最適な音ゲーです。
未だにXboxコントローラーになれない方は一度手に取ってみてください。

音ゲーとしての難易度は若干高めだと思いますが、前述したように箱コンの練習になりますし、
慣れれば慣れるほどおっ〇いが・・・・いや
料理が上手になっていきます。達成感があっていいですね。やったね。

Normal（普）は結構ムズイです。(スーファミの呪い
個人的な感想ですが、音ゲーに慣れてても、スーファミの呪いを受けてる方にはキツイと思います。
慣れない方は素直にEasy(易)で遊ぶといいと思います。
Easy(易)でもおっぱ・・・いや、なんでもないです。

Hard(難)も楽しいです。私はクリアできませんが。
割りと音ゲーとしてもよくできてると思います。

大半の曲が陳腐ですが、ボス的なキャラの曲はボーカルも入ってて気合が入ってて好印象でした。

総合的にいい音ゲーだと思います。
私もHard(難)をクリアできるようにがんばろうかと思える作品です。

っていうかスーファミの呪いまじできつい

author: {'steamid': '76561198262552775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1559395078}
review:
sv,ev 한 후 어쩌다 꺼무위키 돌고나서야 알게 된 데카모리 섬란카구라. 그 정도로 존재감이 없는 게임이지만 의외로 되게 재밌었음. 볼륨은 작지만 다른 시리즈에 비해서 가격도 낮아서 가볍게 즐기고 다음 시리즈로 넘어가면 된다고 생각함. sv, ev의 스토리에선 나오지 않는 캐릭터 조합도 있으니 섬란시리즈를 제대로 파보려는 사람이라면 당연히 하는게 좋다ㅇㅇ 

글고 sv,ev와 달리 이것만큼은 키보드로 하는게 좋다고 생각함. 판정이 후해서 기모-링

author: {'steamid': '76561198127853956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1563625565}
review:
この作品を一言で表すと，「狂気」である．

・OPが狂っている．吹っ切れすぎ．
・司会（霧夜先生）も吹っ切れてる．
・料理が美味いと服が破れる．
・バトル後は全裸になってる．
・全裸後に女体盛りになる．意味が分からん．
・天ぷらになりたいやつとか，太巻き以外認めないやつとか，ハーレムを作るやつとか，異常者が多い．
・電子レンジに冷凍食品を入れたり，カップ麺にお湯を入れることを料理と言い張るやつがいる．
・ミスター味っ子，焼き立てジャパンよろしく，過剰なリアクション芸．

祭りだね．もうなんでもいいや．

ゲーム内容は横スクロールの音ゲー．難易度は３つ用意されており，どれでクリアしても全クリ扱いになる，上級者にも初級者にも優しい設計．ただし，実績コンプを目指す人は難易度普通は必要となる．

閃乱カグラSVまでのストーリーを知っていれば楽しめるようになっているので，爆乳ハイパーバトラーの皆さんは必ず購入しよう．IQ溶かして日々のストレスを解消すべし．

author: {'steamid': '76561198319557946', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1590141292}
review:
This is a rhythm game spinoff from the main Senran Kagura beat 'em up series featuring all our adorable ninja waifus. Gameplay is pretty easy on Easy mode (except for Rin's song which is significantly harder than the rest of the songs), timing needed for button presses is quite forgiving. Each girl's Story mode playthrough takes 30-45 minutes, where she faces off against 5 opponents in a cooking contest. Each round is divided into 3 segments. If you do well during the first 2 segments, your opponent is stripped of her clothing until she is left in her underwear in the third segment, where a heart prompt will appear that allows the camera to zoom in on her body and feminine charms. Additionally, if you're able to trigger the heart prompt during the third segment, you'll be rewarded with a diorama of your opponent covered in nothing but whipped cream and chocolate sauce served on a dish at the end of the round. Most of the difficulty comes from trying to sneak a peek at the girls bodies without dropping your combo (which happened to me an embarrassing amount of times especially once they were down to their undies).

As this is a Senran Kagura game, you'll certainly not be disappointed with the huge amount of fanservice, sexual innuendo, lewd symbolism and comedy. Breast physics are exaggerated and there is no actual nudity (not counting mods). Lots of costumes (including all the DLC from the Vita release) and panties available for those of you who enjoy the dress up aspect of these games. The intimacy mode is quite lacking in this version compared to the other Senran Kagura games, though.

Each of the 22 girls have their own unique personalities and quirks, and individual motivations for joining the Super Dish Gourmet Cook-Off. Each girl's story is short, but filled with lots of humor, ridiculousness and sometimes wholesomeness. 

However, the gameplay can get quite repetitive very quickly (especially if you're not into rhythm games) and the fanservice can only stay exciting for so long. This game is best played in short spurts at a time. A PS4/Xbox controller is highly recommended but optional.

Oh, and it is practically impossible to play this game one-handed, even on Easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198858190851', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1556469119}
review:
I like Senran Kagura games, but I cannot recommend this one. It is just a very simple mini-game.
Overall the game is quite fun and fast-paced with good music. It has what you'd expect from a basic rhythm game but nothing more. The animations and gameplay are very repetitive and the story mode is really bad, not fun at all.
The graphics are very simplistic and low resolution, even worse than Shinovi Versus. Dualshock 4 is supported but you have to disable everything related to controller settings on Steam for it to actually work.
I also felt like this game is not well balanced. You can perfect-score every song until the last one, then if you fail just a few notes on the last song, you fail the entire story mode! It's quite frustrating....
Even if you like Senran Kagura characters and rhythm games, SK Bon Appétit is a low quality experience. For the price they are asking for it's not worth it, even if it's on sale. Use the money to buy other SK game like PBS or Burst Renewal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036913791', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 1677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1548403127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046016145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3047, 'last_played': 1590896550}
review: Before, I was uninterested in this series due to its absurd nature. However, I'm a huge fan of clothing damage (even it it's unexplained in this instance) and a rhythm game seemed like a nice change of pace from killing thousands of clones in a shooter game. It was a rocky start at first since I was still getting used to the controller I was using, but I gradually got better at it and became a fan of Yozakura. As I played more, I realized how good the dress-up customization was, and while the plot is silly I found myself really enjoying certain parts of the walls of text between battles. Medium difficulty eventually got repetitive, which resulted in a huge spike when I switched to hard. I find myself enjoying hard but switching back to medium for a given battle since it's anti-climactic when you strip them down to their underwear but then do nothing else to them unless you get both halves of the hearts and win. Finally, the dress-up room has some EXCELLENT INTERACTIONS with the girls using your controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101274596', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1541125628}
review:
Este juego lo compre 2 veces, ya que la primera ocasión no permitia jugar con el control de Xbox One, solamente con el de PS, lo cual me orillo a solicitar un reembolso.

Posteriormente alguien comento que el juego ya permitia sin problemas el uso del control por lo que volvi a comprarlo y efectivamente sin problema alguno.

Ahora en cuanto al titulo en si, este te vende un juego de ritmo, sin embargo; no es ese el verdadero fin del juego, sino mostrar oppais y demas zukulencia al ritmo de la batalla, la cual por cierto solo en ciertas canciones resulta emocionante.

La mayoría de las melodías son lentas y poco variadas, en dificultad facil son muy muy sencillas, sin embargo cuando llegas a la última fase, la dificultad facil da un salto exagerado hasta difícil pues esta se vuelve incluso frustrante por no poder concluirla hasta después de muchos intentos.

Gráficamente el juego no tiene una calidad visul perfecta pues es un port de la versión de Psvita, sin embargó la zukulencia sigue presente, medio acartonada pero ahi esta.

Vale la pena comprarlo? Yo diria que si pero solo en descuento y si este es mayor del 50% de lo contrario mejor invertirlo en Senran Kagura PBS que es aun mas divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244010536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1552614935}
review:
I really do appreciate the work put into the port and the button prompt color coding, but I have complaints. 

I haven't played any other Senran Kagura games, so I didn't know what to expect. I don't know if the songs in this game come from their other titles, but the music in this game is certainly not to my preference. It is really hard to get into a rhythm game that doesn't have a soundtrack you can get into. For this and this alone, I cant recommend this game.

On a much smaller note, it is weird that sometimes during cutscenes, only one of the girl's boobs will wobble all by itself like it has a mind of its own. Also, these girls have feet like bricks. Normally you aren't looking at them so it isn't a huge issue, but when you do, it is obvious they could use more jpeg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380614941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1655630610}

author: {'steamid': '76561198156231045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1638287131}
review:
Já venho há muito tempo querendo comprar esse jogo, ao contrário de suas outras versões, este jogo não tem qualquer dlc e isso o torna perfeito, lamento pelas outras versões que roubam o jogador com tanta dlc cara que em nada acrescentam no jogo na minha opnião, se todos fossem como este jogo, eu compraria, sendo assim, vou ficar apenas com o Bon appetit.
Um jogo bem legal, com mods fica ainda melhor, sinto a falta de algumas cenas mais evoluidas na historia, acho que ficou muito fraco nesse ponto, eu basicamente ignoro toda a história do jogo e as imagens dele tambem não nada de especial, na verdade uma desilusão a esse ponto, tambem tem vários itens bugados e outras muitas coisas que vão incomodar o jogador durante o jogo, mas claramente tem seus aspetos positivos que fazem eu acreditar que este jogo é realmente bom, mesmo com seus erros, que o jogador vai ter que aprender a superar.
Temos uma variedade de roupa desbloqueável de graça, o que comparado com os outros jogos da franquia, é realmente muito bom, fico feliz por isso, o jogo tambem trás uma variedade de coisas especiais para fazer, conteudo diversicado e vários três niveis de dificuldade, as cenas delas cozinhando são um pouco bugadas mas legais, mas nem tem tempo para ficar apressiando, o jogo é frenetico algumas musicas não tem como largar o dedo do teclado, e isso é mais um aspeto positivo.
O melhor do jogo é o velho, sério.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109543985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1548118381}
review:
音ゲー＆バカゲーです、何も考えずに遊べるゲーム
基本は方向キーの左、下、右とボタンのY、B、A（XBOXコントローラー時）の６つです
忍術ボタンもあるので7つ使います
方向キーとボタンはDivaシリーズと違って色が一緒でもそのボタンを押さないとダメなので注意

慣れないうちは死にゲーですがすぐ慣れると思います、
判定は結構緩めです、体感多少ずれていても極上判定になる
易しいでやれば音ゲー苦手でも、何回かやれば行けると思います

スコア狙いの時はキャラに視線を向けない方がいいです、
料理しているところが結構面白いのです、超高速で包丁振り回していたりとか

ストーリーもどれもぶっ飛んでいて面白いです
料理を食べるシーンが完全に料理漫画の演出です、何故か女の子の服も破けますし、
圧倒的な実力を見せると対戦相手も料理になります

PS4のコントローラー使用時はPlay Stationコントローラーサポートを切っておかないと表示がABYになるかもです
Big Pictureモードから設定見直しましょう

author: {'steamid': '76561198177851061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1611788689}
review:
Pros:
+ Appealing visuals *wink wink*
+ A handful of catchy tracks (Homura's track is my favorite in particular)
+ Lots of customization for all of the characters
+ Controller support

Cons:
- The fact that it's a port of a PlayStation Vita title definitely shows, textures and images can appear pixelated on close-ups.
- Only one track per character, meaning a total of only 22 tracks, could potentially get repetitive for some players.
- Kind of wish the game had more multiplayer features other than just an online leaderboard.

Overall I really enjoy this game. Being a rhythm game it's obviously not like other Senran Kagura titles, but if you like the characters from said other titles you'll most likely enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004532679', 'num_games_owned': 16670, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1545581295}
review:
섬란 카구라 시리즈의 외전격인 작품으로
닌자 전투가 아닌 데카모리 요리대회를 주제로 한 리듬액션 게임이다.
아무래도 본격적인 리듬게임은 아니여서 조금 투박한 면이 있지만
전반적인 완성도는 나름대로 괜찮은 편이라고 생각한다.
그리고 섬란 카구라다운 노출과 선정성은 여전하고 
승부에서 승리한 다음 여체그릇을 감상하는 맛도 상당하다. 
또한 각 캐릭터의 스토리도 잘 짜여져 있기 때문에 스토리 보는 재미도 있다.
섬란 카구라 시리즈를 좋아하는 사람이라면 해볼만한 작품이라고 생각한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160320827', 'num_games_owned': 4085, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 1985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1985, 'last_played': 1543664900}
review:
[h1]おっぱいどアップは卑怯だ。
さすが忍者きたない[/h1]

2018/12/08
全実績解除したのでレビュー

誰もが知る[strike] おっぱいゲーム[/strike]激アツ忍者ゲーム『閃乱カグラ』のシリーズ番外的音ゲー。
シリアス味は一切無く、ギャグオンリーで、料理を作ってもやっぱり服は脱げる仕様。ですよね。

音ゲー的には難易度は高いかも。
ノードはAWSD←↑↓→の八種類、上下二列のレーンに流れてきます。
レーンで流れてくるものが決まっているわけではなく、上に右手キーが来ることもあれば、左手キーが来ることもあります。色が同じなので、それの見極めがキツい。

全曲難しいでクリアするのは、キーボードじゃ難しすぎる。
全パンツ取得の実績解除条件が全曲全難易度クリアなのに、そりゃないぜとっつぁん。

全実績解除したい人に対しての救済措置で、パンツ全取得の裏技コマンドもあるのだけれど、自分はキーボードで入力できませんでした。
（自分のキーボードの仕様のせいかもしれませんが）
ですので、そこだけは注意。

そのためにPS4タイプのコントローラーを買ったようなもの。
結局、コントローラーで難しい全曲クリアしたけどね！

コマンド入力できなくて、難しいをクリアできない人
[spoiler] タイム連打を試すのも一つの手です[/spoiler]
もはや音ゲーでもなんでもないけど

難易度普通はわりとノリノリで遊べるので
実績解除に興味ない人にはオススメ。
心を無にして戦え。

author: {'steamid': '76561198045370126', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1658683063}
review:
★★★★☆☆ 

steamの数少ない８ボタン対応した音ゲーで、
最もすばらしい点は何と言っても３つの難易度がしっかり作られているということです。
要は簡単にパーフェクト点が取れるヌード目当ての難易度に、集中しないとなかなかクリアーできない物から、連打の嵐の高難易度まで。

それに他の音ゲーと比べて、キャラクターが個性的でかわいいし、背景のアニメーションも良く動いて、内容もエッチだし、司会者の言動は面白いし、
疲れたおじさん達の元気剤として、ものすごいポテンシャルを秘めていると思います。
やりこみ要素は、音ゲーとしての高得点狙いキャラクターのコスチューム集めと着替えと鑑賞です。ジャッポンらしい作品です。

ただ残念な点は、ＳＦＣパッドの十字キーだけが反応しませんでしたので外部ツールのJoyAdapterを使いました。あと、外部から好きな音楽を入れて遊ぶことはできません。


ファンじゃない人でも楽しめると思います。おすすめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031001203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1547004850}
review: It's an alright game, i don't have any problem with rythme games, but i'm really surprised after how many years people have been making games, especially games with controller and gamepad support that noone has ever thought to make an option for changing what the button prompts look like, it cant be all that hard to make a few extra icons for different controller buttons and have an option for Cross, Square, Triangle, and Circle, or A,B,X,Y etc... i've grown used to using a DS4 controller for steam and it supports it but doesnt show ds4 ui buttons so it normally just gets me flustered when im trying to remember which one is which since my brain is so wired on remembering Cross, Square, Triangle, and Circle. it's like developers are afraid to give people too many options and settings and just tries to make everything autodetected which is nice but also wouldnt kill the game to have the options to correct it with options when its wrong or be able to change small things for the tiny variations in useable gamepads.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038595872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1535047781}
review:
Las Kunoichi de Seran Kagura tienen duelos culinarios

+ Aquí si que hay melones de verdad
+ La comida siempre gusta, las tetas también
+ La ropa se sigue rompiendo, mágicamente, pero se sigue rompiendo
+ Y si la ropa se sigue rompiendo, si, podemos desnudar al oponente
+ Tiene sus historias con cada personaje, con sus tetas y comida incluidas
+ Su música esta guay, las tetas también
+ Comida a 60fps, con tetas incluidas

- El juego es cuanto menos curioso, no sigue la linea principal de la saga y su jugabilidad se basa en apretar botones mientras escuchas música, ellas cocinan, ect.... a quien le guste muy bien por el, a mi ni fu ni fa, pero las tetas siempre están hay, eso que no falte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132027282', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1529689452}
review:
Weird is the best word to describe it. Hold on, it's not about the exploding clothes and anime boobs;  I've watched enough anime and played too much Japanese game to be disturbed by this.

I will be the first to admit that I am not well versed in rhythm games; however, through the experience of playing this game, even I can come into a conclusion that having more than 2 buttons to press is a questionable game design. Let me remind you that the main selling point or gimmick of this game, the sole thing that differentiates this game from other rhythm games, is the fact that it has Senran Kagura mechanics; aka clothing breaks/tears as the battle going on. To put it bluntly, the rhythm game mechanics go against the fundamental spirit of this game.

At the easiest difficulty, there are 6 different buttons that you need to prepare to press, factoring in that there are long press, rapid press, and special animation button, full attention needs be paid to the button prompts.  Again, if this is a normal rhythm game, it is not a problem, but if the game wants you to also simultaneously look at the girls, one button press ala rythm Rythm Heaven is the only suitable mechanics. Alternatively, Crypt of Necrodancer's style of button press will also work decently. In addition, normal or higher difficulty sometimes mix in 2 buttons press at the same time, on top of adding buttons to press, which turns this game unplayable, unless you have memorized all the key press or song.

Speaking of songs, it is very lackluster for a rhythm game. Every characters only have one song, despite them having 3 different difficulties. Some of the songs do not match the personality of the characters. While we are at it, the characters are also lacking in their usual gimmick or personality. Everyone has the same cooking animation, there are two variants depending on how well you do on the rythm game, but that's about it, the bare minimum that they can get away with.

Animation is not the only thing that's bare minimum, the fanservice is also lazy. Long story short, you have a chance to perv on the girls if you do well in the rythm game, but there is only one pose for it, not to mention that the button press will still  distract you. Plus, considering that there is a "gallery" mode, in which you can look at the characters cooking with whatever outfit and from whatever angles you want, it is redundant.

Another thing that's redundant is the judging part of the cooking. It is repetitive, there is no way to skip it, and the animator is too lazy to actually animate the act of eating. One more thing, can I ask why the judge has to be that guy? One of my favourite part of Suikoden 2 is the cooking mini game, and in that one, they let your party to judge your dishes. That way,  players will care about the reaction, characters can retain/emphasize their personality, and if we apply that to this game, it will be more interesting looking at the girls reactions; believe it or not, you don’t have to strip girls to make it interesting, Marvelous.

All in all, I cannot recommend this game, even when I bought them at 70% sale price. The game lasts for about 2 hours, and I was already bored after I beat the game with one character. If you are looking for a spin off Senran Kagura game, play Peach Beach Splash. It has more effort put into, and while that game still has its own fair share of problems, they are not as glaring as this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993890344', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1530140901}
review: It's an alright little game but its very low quality, not much to it, the story mode is barely a story mode, the story mode in this game is the same as the character missions in the other games, just each character doing their own thing, this time though they all enter a cooking battle, each character you play is basically an alternate universe where they each win. It's a decent little rhythm game but it has some problems, it looks like its been upscaled from a portable console so graphics aren't that great, there isn't much to the gameplay, just tap buttons, there seems to be a different song for each character you face but aside from that there isn't much to it. Was playing on easy mode and its pretty easy, 99% of the time, the only character that's actually difficult is Rin, her level is 10x harder than the rest, everyone else is so easy but hers is just a pain in the ass, I beat it once but after trying to beat it again on another story I messed up and honestly it just ruined the game for me so I won't bother finishing the story mode, if you can call it a story mode, same stuff over and over not much to see. If you're into Senran Kagura though give it a try. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977444987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1529843932}
review:
Not a bad game at all.
Now i`m a bit of a noob to this kind of thing, but wanted something with sexy females with boobage that might be fun to play. So brought this on a sale in case it was rubbish.

Ok, so this game features ladies with big boobs and sexy figures- Can`t complain as a red blooded man. But that said, the game is surprisingly jolly.

The girls feature in a cooking competition, you pick one and must get her to cook a delicious meal for the sensei guy; it`s got to be done faster and better than the other girl who opposes you. 

You have a jolly tune and must hit your control pad buttons in time to the arrows and buttons (and tune) that appears. I almost never use a joypad so i found Normal too hard (VERY unusual for me) and had to go Easy until i can become more familiar with the keys. So if you do rubbishy by missing the keys, your girl starts losing her clothes and in the end you lose, game over. but if you do well, the opposing girl starts losing her clothes and you win to challnge the next girl.

I was very surprised at how well done this was. The gameplay is really `fun` (a word I seldome use), the music really nice and jumpy and before long your tapping the keys and nodding to the music as the girls in the background work frantoically on the culinary delights. In fact i spent more time concentrating on the finger pressing than looking at the sexy ladies!

There is even a version score from Holst, The Planets, not sure how many people will have noticed that! It`s not bad actually.

The Sensei then tries the food and gives you a thumbs up if you win, your girl giggles cutely and on you go.

A much more fun game than i expected and well made. thumbs up.

Now as a final word, I have to say that this kind of game has a really honest and innocent feel to it- it`s just Devs who made a game for guys who want to enjoy some gaming challenge while staring at sexy semi-nude ladies having cute fun. There`s absolutely nothing wrong with it. It is harmless despite what anyone else in their restrictive puritanical sjw manner might say. It epitomises the term `just good male fun`. It really makes me realise what men are missing in the West. there really is nothing for us now except killing things or boring mundane sterility.

In the West today, any Dev house making this genre of game is almost impossible- Feminism destroys ALL the fun of men and continues to do so. The NATURAL fun of men and nobody stood up to it so now we get sterile, sad boring games lacking the kind of innocent fun for males we once had. Feminism (and to some extent women with their cucked men) have destroyed fun. Harmless, harmless fun.

I hope that one day reason, light hearted fun, and commonsense will destroy the obedience to feminism in gaming (and all things) and it will one day die. For now only Japan and the Asian Dev houses understand men and don`t cowtow in fear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137185653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1530472373}
review:
Fans of the Senran Kagura series in its various incarnations know exactly what they're expecting here, and I'm happy to report that they will most likely enjoy this purchase, even at full price.

For those not familiar, Senran Kagura is possibly the most mind-meltingly insane series in existence.  You either "get it" or you don't. There's next to no middle ground. It's full of fanservice and a lot of Yuri content. This particular title deviates from their more standard Dynasty Warriors-style 1 vs. 100 fighting, and into rhythm games, somehow making the series even weirder.

Keyboard controls are surprisingly good, and the music is shockingly solid. I actually find myself enjoying most of the tunes, which is something I didn't expect.

Happily, easy difficulty is legitimately easy, and with little effort, even players who struggle with rhythm games (like myself) can unlock endings and bonus scenes, so I'd have to say this is a pretty accessible title.

There's a ton of content for palyers, with each girl getting her own story mode, each with five chapters. (Figure 20-30 minutes per girl, roughly.)

Then you have arcade mode (six battles, your opponents vary by difficulty) and free mode.

There's a plethora of unlockable outfit components and a dressing room mode, if you're into those things as well. (Obviously, your mileage will vary on those.)

Still, if you don't like a certain amount  of "random japanese weirdness" tropes, or you don't like games with a high sexual content, you should either outright avoid it, or wait for a sale.

Otherwise, this game is even worth it at full price. (Though does anyone buy games at full price on Steam any more?)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972297308', 'num_games_owned': 4497, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1527195939}
review:
Decent rhythm game with a bunch of cute anime girls.

+ [b]Gameplay[/b]: Basic yet decent gameplay. Just hit the right key at the right time.
+ [b]Characters[/b]: I'm not too familiar with the Senran Kagura series, but most of the characters were very likable.
+ [b]Fan service[/b]: Plenty of fan service to be had here. The first time I saw a "special" I [i]did[/i] get distracted and mess up.

- [b]Difficulty[/b]: You don't get punished for hitting the wrong key, so if you're panicking it is possible to just mash all the keys. This makes the game a bit easier than it could (and should) have been, at least on easy and normal difficulty. Luckily hard can still be quite challenging despite this handicap.
- [b]Songs[/b]: Some of the songs were nice and catchy, but many of them felt very generic. Only a handful of the available songs have vocals, which is a petty.
- [b]Graphics[/b]: The game often seems blurry somehow. I've played other rhythm games, and they did not have this problem. I noticed that the game would run at 110+ fps even when I set the fps limit to 60 in the settings menu, which might be the cause of the blurriness.
- [b]Price[/b]: The price seems a bit high. If this game didn't have a bunch of cute girls in it, or wasn't a part of the Senran Kagura series, the price would most likely be a fair bit lower.

If possible I would have given this game a neutral rating, but since that is not possible and since it [i]is[/i] a decent rhythm game I'm giving it a thumbs up. Just get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012052601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1519055585}
review:
[h1]*Your average joke about bobs, vegana and why your parents are dissapointed!*[/h1]

[b]SENRAN KAGURA Bon Appétit! What a game![/b]

This game is a bit different to all the other Senran Kagura games. It is a spinoff like the "Versus" games. The difference is that you don´t have to fight your opponents in a "King of the Fights" style! instead of that you have to beat them in a cooking competition.

[b]The plot is really complex! There is none! Suprised? Well - it is a Senran Kagura game after all! You will just get a short explanation why cute ninja girls do cute and lewdy things! Don´t expect a story like Dragon Age.[/b]

The gameplay is simple and easy. It is a rhythm game and shares many similarities with games like "Guitar Hero"! You have two lines on the bottom of the screen. Symbols (the keys on your keyboard or your gamepad) will appear and slide from the right to the left. Hit the right button at the right moment and you will succeed! If you win you will shred your opponents clothes to shreds! If you lose... well it is your turn to lose some fabrics!
If you do a perfect round it is even getting more lewd! But I don´t want to spoil it for now...

The story mode offers you to play with each girl (each girl has a unique mini story). You also have a tournament mode. It sure can get a bit repetitive after a while, but the different music tracks are well made.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kXkoMcl0Jgw&index=10&list=PL7P4fpaQWDhh_aGCG9Cy5ogzTiDnGGosb
For those who are not used to rhythm games: This is not OSU! or DDR! You can choose between different difficulty settings. Easy mode is easy mode! I would also suggest you to play with a gamepad. It makes the gameplay way easier!

I have to say that I enjoyed this game so far! I highly suggest it to people who wants to get into a rhythm game at all (and because of the lewdy bits)! For all Senran Kagura fans it is a must have!

_____________________________________________________________

Now some self promotion! If you are into lewdy stuff and also don´t mind the hardcore stuff, you are free to join this group: 

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/OkamiShoujo]Kemomimi[/url]

For real content you can also join the Discord channel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025121845', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1536184821}
review:
Spin off de la série Senran Kagura, Bon Appétit! est un jeu de rythme où les filles perdent leurs vêtements durant les musiques, jusqu’à ce que, si vous avez été très bons ou très mauvais, la perdante se retrouve totalement nue.

On l’aura compris, le second degré est ici totalement assumé. Un effort a été fait sur le scénario, chaque fille ayant ses motivations propres pour participer au concours de cuisine qui sert de toile de fond au récit. Sans atteindre bien entendu les talents d’écriture du studio Obsidian, il réussit là où beaucoup d’autres échouent : proposer une histoire que l’on n’a pas forcément envie de passer, afin de voir jusqu’où les scénaristes sont allés ! Et le moins que l’on puisse dire, c’est qu’ils sont allés loin…

Un autre de ses points forts est la customisation : Bon Appétit! nous vient sur PC dans une édition GOTY, dite Full Course. Avant même d’avoir débloqué quoi que ce soit, nous avons donc des possibilités très grandes pour changer les vêtements selon nos envies, rajouter des accessoires, changer les coupes de cheveux…Bref, une variété qui fait plaisir !

Bien que nous ayons accès à moult tenues, les graphismes ne font hélas pas honneur à celles-ci : Senran Kagura Bon Appétit! était sorti sur Vita, et ça se voit. On n’aurait pas été contre un travail supplémentaire, sur les personnages par exemple, qui sont bien lisses. Cela aurait exigé un coût de développement  supplémentaire, qui, malheureusement, n’aurait certainement pas été rentable…Le portage est néanmoins très bon, n’ayant eu aucun bug et ma manette Xbox One ayant été reconnue nativement. 

D’un point de vue gameplay, on assimile rapidement les bases : si vous avez déjà joué à un jeu de rythme, vous ne serez pas dépaysé : le concept est addictif, simple à prendre en main, et efficace. La playlist n’est toutefois pas assez variée : pour terminer l’histoire d’un personnage, il faut faire cinq musiques à la suite. Il y a vingt-deux personnages, et chacun d’eux en a une spécifique. Elles reviennent donc extrêmement vite, et, pour peu que nous enchaînions trois-quatre histoires à la suite, on se retrouve à faire deux, voire trois fois la même ! Pour plus de variété, on aurait aimé que chaque personnage en ait deux différentes, même si là encore, le coût de développement aurait été bien plus élevé...

On conseillera donc de faire ce jeu par petites sessions, pour éviter de se lasser trop rapidement : deux personnages que vous faites pendant une soirée, après le travail par exemple, est une bonne moyenne. La difficulté n’étant d’ailleurs pas très élevée, hormis deux-trois musiques qui nécessitent de recommencer,  il est parfait pour se détendre, à moins que vous vouliez tenter le mode difficile : celui-ci nécessite beaucoup d’entraînement et d’essais avant de réussir à faire un score convenable. 

C’est là un de ses défauts : étant donné que nous faisons les histoires des personnages dans l’ordre que nous souhaitons, il n’y a pas de courbe de difficulté, nous n’avons pas vraiment de sentiment de progression. Qu’on vienne de commencer le jeu ou qu’on l’ait terminé, le mode difficile pose les mêmes obstacles, à peine plus facilement surmontables pour celui qui a fait l’histoire de tous les personnages…

Il n’en reste pas moins que Senran Kagura Bon Appétit!, sans être excellent, fait passer de très bons moments : on s’y amuse, on rit, on est ébahi, on se demande jusqu’où ça va aller, ça va encore plus loin que ce qu’on imaginait, bref, une curiosité venue tout droit du Japon qu’on aurait tort de négliger !
